Interface SolidCollider

All Superinterfaces:
CollidingObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExampleMouseListener
public interface SolidCollider
extends CollidingObject
Interface to be implemented by any object that must not allow an object to pass through it
This interface extends CollidingObject, so you only need to implement this one.

In the constructor
CollidingObject.addCollider(this);

SolidCollider.addSolidCollider(this);


In the tick method
CollidingObject.getCollisions(this);

Before your movement code, use 
CollidingObject.willCauseSolidCollision(this, ...);

Example
if(!SolidCollider.willCauseSolidCollision(this, this.velX, true)) {
                        this.x += this.velX;
                }
                if(!SolidCollider.willCauseSolidCollision(this, this.velY, false)) {
                        this.y += this.velY;
                }

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.util.LinkedList<SolidCollider> solidColliders
    A LinkedList maintaining all classes implementing SolidCollider
    (all objects that could collide with each other)

    Fields inherited from interface CollidingObject

    colliders

  • Method Summary

    Static Methods
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void addSolidCollider​(SolidCollider s)
    Adds a SolidCollider object to the solidColliders list.
    Should be called in the constructor of a class implementing SolidCollider
    static boolean willCauseSolidCollision​(CollidingObject o, int vel, boolean xAxis)
    Determines if a given movement along a single axis will cause a collision with a solid object
    Should be used to determine if a given movement can be performed e.g.

    Methods inherited from interface CollidingObject

    getBounds, handleCollisions

  • Field Details

    • solidColliders

      static final java.util.LinkedList<SolidCollider> solidColliders
      A LinkedList maintaining all classes implementing SolidCollider
      (all objects that could collide with each other)

  • Method Details

    • addSolidCollider

      static void addSolidCollider​(SolidCollider s)
      Adds a SolidCollider object to the solidColliders list.
      Should be called in the constructor of a class implementing SolidCollider
      Parameters:
      object - The object to be added to the SolidColliders list

    • willCauseSolidCollision

      static boolean willCauseSolidCollision​(CollidingObject o, int vel, boolean xAxis)
      Determines if a given movement along a single axis will cause a collision with a solid object
      Should be used to determine if a given movement can be performed e.g.
       if(!SolidCollider.willCauseSolidCollision(this, this.velX, true)) {
                        this.x += this.velX;
                }
                if(!SolidCollider.willCauseSolidCollision(this, this.velY, false)) {
                        this.y += this.velY;
                }
      Parameters:
      o - The CollidingObject you'd like to test for potential collisions
      vel - The velocity in the direction specified by the xAxis param
      xAxis - A boolean identifying the direction of proposed movement
      Returns:
      A boolean representing whether a collision will occur by a proposed action
